notes.text: We now ensure that the table shown in a value help is correctly destroyed when the value help dialog is closed
End users can now remove the columns displaying values from navigation properties that contain currency and unit properties and add the columns back using table personalization
We now ensure that the header of building block columns is properly cached in the table personalization
We now ensure that the header level for titles in the quick view is set correctly
The main navigation and additional links in a quick view now provide implicit semantic object mapping
We now support Core.AlternateKeys to allow app developers to force the fetching of alternate properties when loading an object page
We've now increased the default column size in forms for medium and large size screens
We now allow overflowing of object page header buttons in small screens
We now ensure that the field change event name remains consistent with the public API
We now correctly show the column header of line items annotated as dataFieldForAnnotations
We now ensure that sort order works correctly for value help
We now ensure that the dropdown list loads all values
We now ensure that screen readers inform users when an upload file is mandatory
We've now improved the documentation for properties of the Column building block
We now ensure that a link in the FileWrapper also wraps long filenames with no spaces
The mass edit functionality now works correctly when the SideEffects annotation contains an asterisk
We now ensure that the Share: Microsoft Teams functionality works correctly in our building blocks
The enableFullScreen option now also works correctly on tables outside of an object page
We now correctly display the titles of form containers and form action toolbars when sending information to a section
We've resolved an issue where fields were not shown if a maximum annotation or a minimum annotation was used but no date annotation was used in validation
We no longer request the field description if the table is refreshed using the mass edit functionality
We’ve resolved an issue where the UI.HiddenFilter annotation was not correctly applied to the chart filter option
You can now clear the field values of non-string fields using the mass edit dialog
Columns with a specific scale for a given unit of measure are now correctly exported
Custom filters now work correctly in the FilterBar building block
We now ensure links of email addresses aren’t truncated when the screen is resized
We’ve resolved an issue where the default message strip for a draft-enabled app was incorrectly displayed on the chart of an app that was not draft-enabled
